original_title: Sri Lanka’s Bimputh Finance directors fined Rs1mn for annual report violation
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Disciplinary action has been taken against the Board of Directors of Bimputh Finance Plc for its failure to submit an annual report in violation of the Listing Rules, the Colombo Stock Exchange said in a statement.
Bimputh Finance had failed to submit its annual report for the financial year ended March 31, 2022 as required in terms of Rule 7.5 (a) (i) of the CSE Listing Rules.

“Having considered the continued non-compliance of the Listing Rules by the Company, a penalty of Rupees one million (Rs. 1,000,000) was imposed on each director of the Board of Directors of the Company on 5th January 2024.”
In September 2023, Sri Lanka’s central bank cancelled the license of Bimputh Finance Plc. (Colombo/Jan9/2024)
